text.p: The National Bank of Hungary (NBH) is to reduce the current 18 county directorates to eight regional directorates effective January 1, 1997, the NBH said in a statement.
The eight directorates will be in the provincial cities of Debrecen, Gyor, Miskolc, Kecskemet, Szeged, Szekesfehervar, Zalaegerszeg and Pecs, the NBH said.

The reorganisation is part of the NBH's two- to three-year development program designed to meet international standards and to conform more realistically to Hungary's limited size, the statement said. -- Budapest newsroom (36 1) 327-4040
